title: Effect of Nanosilver Particles on Daphnia

content.description: A student reads that nanosilver particles are used in cosmetics to allow nutrients to penetrate deeper into the skin. When the cosmetics are washed off, the nanosilver particles can enter freshwater ecosystems. These particles may decrease survival in many aquatic organisms. The student determines that Daphnia magna, a tiny freshwater crustacean widely found in North America, might make a good test subject for an experiment.
content.question: Which statement below is the most likely testable hypothesis based on the information provided?

choices.label: When the concentration of nanosilver particles in water and the temperature of water are both increased, the population of Daphnia magna will decrease.
When the concentration of nanosilver particles in water is increased, the population of Daphnia magna will decrease.
When the concentration of nanosilver particles in water is increased, the population of Daphnia magna will adapt to new conditions and become a new species.
When the concentration of nanosilver particles in water is decreased, the population of aquatic organisms that feed on Daphnia magna will increase.

content.answer: When the concentration of nanosilver particles in water is increased, the population of Daphnia magna will decrease.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify a testable hypothesis or scientific question for an investigation.
